revised_title: Alfred William Alcock: A Pioneering Medical Officer and Naturalist
tldr: Alfred William Alcock was a remarkable medical officer and naturalist who made significant contributions to marine biology and zoology during his service in India. His passion for science began in his early years, and he went on to become a surgeon-naturalist, Deputy Sanitary Commissioner, and Superintendent of the Indian Museum. Alcock's work in marine zoology and his experiences traveling and exploring the world left a lasting impact on the field of natural history.
